result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:46 PM Defendant Justin J. Burnett not in court.  Attorney Carl W Knepel in court for Justin J. Burnett.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failed to appear for initial appearance.
Arrest warrant authorized.  Defendant is to be remanded into custody in order to take care of this warrant.
DEFENDANT IS TO BE REMANDED TO THE JAIL. DEFENDANT IS TO BE DENIED BY PUBLIC DEFENDER FOR SPECIAL BAIL APPEARANCE. DEFENDANT MUST REPORT IMMEDIATELY TO THE JAIL FOR BOOKING.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matters are continued for status conference on 10-17-22 at 1:30 PM in Branch 1.  Bail is set at $1500 recognizance bond with the conditions that the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and the defendant is not to possess any controlled substance or drug paraphernalia, this includes constructive possession.  Defendant is remanded into custody on another matter.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.

records.addlTxt:
1:43 PM Defendant Justin J. Burnett appeared in person.  Attorney Nathan J. Heim appeared in court for Justin J. Burnett, Attorney Jacalyn Labre appeared for Attorney Anthony Lambrecht by video for State of Wisconsin. Inducement letter provided.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial. ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information to be filed/has been filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  March 11, 2022.  Defendant will be exercising his right to substitution.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.    Preliminary hearing is set for 02-07-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Initial appearance on January 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Warrant canceled and original returned to Clerk's office.

Defendant in person, having appeared voluntarily on warrant, by zoom. The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-24-22 at 1:30 pm. Br. 1.  The $100.00 cash bail previously furnished is continued, along with all conditions.  
Minutes.
Nathan Heim, Public Defender.

2:51 PM Defendant Justin J. Burnett did not appear, Special appearance by Attorney Nathan Heim on behalf of the defendant, Attorney Angelina Scarpelli appeared in person for State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant fails to appear for today's initial appearance. 
Court authorizes a warrant for the defendant and orders forfeiture of cash bail.

$100.00 cash bail furnished and defendant released form custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail - 
Judith Koehnke @ 1029 S. 14th Street, Manitowoc,WI
Order for prints.
RE:  Possess THC-2nd offense, on 01-12-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess THC - 2nd offense, 3 counts felony bail jumping and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-18-22 at 2:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $100.00 cash with the condition that he not possess any controlled substance or drug paraphernalia; this includes constructive possession.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at MTSO.
Minutes.
